description: The Chokwe use masquerades to engage with their ancestors, encouraging them to guide, protect, and educate the living. The chihongo is the male counterpart to the female mwana pwo mask. Its feathered headdress, red coloring, scarification patterns, stylized beard, and filed teeth are all markers of wisdom, leadership, and status.
artist_info:
Chokwe
Angola or Democratic Republic of the Congo
Central Africa
title: Male Face Mask (Chihongo)
